member.name: T:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader
member.summary: Implements a virtual log file reader that reads all log files concurrently and returns the log items from all files in the order of their time value.
member.remarks: This class is full of .NET 4.0 code so it's not included in the NET20 project altogether.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.EventWaitHandle)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the FieldLogFileGroupReader class. This sets up log readers for each priority and links additional readers for existing files to them. A FileSystemWatcher is set up to add new files as they are created.
member.param: The path and file prefix of the log files to read.
true to load a single file only. must be a full file name then.
The wait handle that will be signalled after all files have been read to the end and if the last reader is now going to wait for further data to be appended to the file.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.ReadWaitHandleTask(System.Threading.EventWaitHandle)
member.summary: Waits for all priority readers to wait, then sets the readWaitHandle event. Loops until the closeEvent is set.
member.param: The EventWaitHandle instance to set.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.WaitForNewFilePrio
member.summary: Implements the task that waits for a log file for a new priority to be created.
member.returns: The return value is not used.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.WaitForClose
member.summary: Implements the task that waits for the close event.
member.returns: The return value is not used.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.fsw_Created(System.Object,System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the FileSystemWatcher found a newly created file of the currently used log file set.

member.param: Indicates whether the reader was created from a FileSystemWatcher event.

member.summary: Reads the next log item from the log file group. If all files have been read until the end, this method blocks until a new log item was written to any file, or until the close event was set.
member.returns: The next log item, or null if there are no more log items and the waiting was cancelled.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileGroupReader.ReadLogItemAsync
member.summary: Starts a new Task that calls the ReadLogItem method.
member.returns: The new Task instance.

member.summary: Sets the close signal to stop waiting for and reading log items.

member.summary: Supports the iteration over log items in a sequence of FieldLogFileReader instances linked by their NextReader property.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileEnumerator.#ctor(Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the FieldLogFileEnumerator class.
member.param: The first file reader instance.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileEnumerator.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of all FieldLogFileReader in this enumerator, beginning with the first.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next log item of the currently read log file. If there are no more items in this file and there is a NextReader set, the first log item of the next file reader is selected. If there are no more items in this file and WaitMode is set, the method will block until another log item is appended to the current file or the wait operation is cancelled by a close event.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next log item; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first log item of the first log file. WARNING: This function is not used yet and may not work as expected. It is implemented as part of the IEnumerator interface and probably does not work correctly regarding the WaitMode flag because it is re-reading from used readers.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.TryReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to read bytes from the file.
member.param: Number of bytes to read.
member.returns: Bytes read from the file, if all bytes were available; null otherwise.
member.remarks: If not all requested bytes were available to read, the bytes that were already available are stored in a buffer and the method returns null. The next time this method is called, the bytes that are still missing are read. This must be repeated until the method does not return null.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the open log file.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.FormatVersion
member.summary: Gets the format version of the log file.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.WaitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a read operation should wait until all requested data is available in the file. If true, read operations will block; otherwise read operations may return null. This property is thread-safe.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.ItemCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items that have been read by this FieldLogFileReader instance since it has been created or reset.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.NextReader
member.summary: Gets or sets a follow-up reader to use when this file has been read till the end. Setting a value for NextReader unsets WaitMode for this reader. This property is thread-safe.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.IsClosing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the reader is closing.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogFileReader.ReadWaitHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the wait handle that will be signalled after the file has been read to the end and if the reader is now going to wait for further data to be appended to the file.

member.summary: Indicates whether the path for writing log files has already been set.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.customLogFilePrefix
member.summary: Application-defined custom log file prefix. Used for all log directories tested in the default strategy, but not when customLogFileBasePath is set.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.customLogFileBasePath
member.summary: Application-defined custom log file base path. If set, this is tried first.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.customLogFileBasePathSet
member.summary: Indicates whether an application-defined path for writing log files has already been set. If false, no log files are written and all buffers are retained, except when FieldLog is shutting down. In the latter case, the default automatic path selection is used and files are written if a working path was found. This is so that start-up errors that occur before the application could set a custom path can be logged at least somewhere.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.customLogPathLock
member.summary: Lock object for setting a custom log path.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.maxFileSize
member.summary: Maximum size of any single log file. Only set when the send thread is stopped.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.maxTotalSize
member.summary: Maximum size of all log files together. Only set when the send thread is stopped.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.priorityKeepTimes
member.summary: Minimum time to keep log items of each priority. Only set when the send thread is stopped.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.priorityLastPurgeTimes
member.summary: Time when the log files of each priority were last purged. Only used in the send thread.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.totalSizeLastPurgeTime
member.summary: Time when the total size of all log files was last checked. Only used in the send thread.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.configChanged

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.configFileWatcher

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.configFileName

member.summary: Called when the current process exits.

remarks.para: The processing time in this event is limited. All handlers of this event together must not take more than ca. 3 seconds. The processing will then be terminated.
This method is called on a pool thread.

member.summary: Called when the current AppDomains is unloaded.

This method is called on a pool thread.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.Use
member.summary: Does nothing. By referencing the FL type with this method call, it is ensured that the FL type initialiser (static constructor) is called. This method can be used if no other FL member can reasonably be accessed directly at application startup, just to ensure that the unhandled exception handling is active right from the start.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.RegisterAppErrorHandler
member.summary: Registers application error handlers for all application types.
member.remarks: This method is called from the FL static constructor, and only if no debugger is currently attached. A debugger should catch exceptions instead of us.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.BreakIfStackTraceLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Breaks the debugged process if the stack trace is currently at least the thecified number of frames long. This method can be used to halt for debugging before Visual Studio can't display the complete stack trace anymore, or a StackOverflowException is thrown by the runtime (which prevents any further analysis of the stack). Does nothing if no debugger is attached.
member.param: The minimum length of the stack trace to break for.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.CheckAddBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the current buffer size and adds it to the sending queue and creates a new one.
member.param: Size of the next item to add. If 0, the current buffer is always added for sending.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.Flush
member.summary: Sends all remaining buffers regardless of their size or the regular timeout. Buffers already dequeued by the send thread cannot be flushed.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down the log queue. All remaining items will be sent but no new items will be accepted.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.OnSendTimeout(System.Object)
member.summary: Send timeout handler that adds the current buffer for sending even before it has reached its maximum size.
member.param: Unused.
member.remarks: This method is called on a pool thread.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.SendThread
member.summary: Background thread function that waits for new buffers to send them.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.SendBuffers
member.summary: Dequeues all enqueued buffers and sends them.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.SetCustomLogFilePrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an application-defined prefix for the log files. The default is the file name of the entry assembly without its extension.
member.param: The new log file name prefix.
member.remarks: This method must be called before AcceptLogFileBasePath. SetCustomLogFileBasePath effectively overwrites the file prefix so both methods cannot be used together.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.SetCustomLogFileBasePath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an application-defined base path for writing log files to.
member.param: Log file base path. This is an absolute path to a directory and a file name prefix.
member.remarks: FieldLog tries to find a working path to write log files to automatically. The application can specify a custom path that will be tried before all automatic defaults. If this path is null or doesn't work, the other default paths are tested and the first working path will be used. No attempt to find a working path is made until this method or is called.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.AcceptLogFileBasePath
member.summary: Accepts FieldLogs default log path strategy or a path specified in the flconfig file.
member.remarks: Calling this method just tells FieldLog that the default paths are okay and logs shall be written there if not specified otherwise in the flconfig file. No attempt to find a working path is made until this method or is called.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.TestLogPaths
member.summary: Detects and stores a working path for writing log files to.
member.returns: true if a path has been set, false to defer writing to a later time.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.WriteLogReadmeFile
member.summary: Writes a readme text file to the log directory that explains the user what to do with these files. If the file already exists, it will not be recreated.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.PurgeAllFiles
member.summary: Purges log files of all priorities where necessary.

member.name: M:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.PurgePriority(Unclassified.FieldLog.FieldLogPriority)
member.summary: Purges log files of the specified priority if necessary.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.LogFileBasePath
member.summary: Gets the currently used log file base path. This is an absolute path to a directory and a file name prefix. To write other application-specific log files to that directory, just append a file name suffix and extension (not .fl) to this value. If this value is null, no path has been specified yet (log file writing is deferred) or no working path could be found (no files will be written at all).

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.FL.WaitForItemsBacklog

This avoids item loss when flushing at process shutdown but may lead to considerable delays in rare cases of high logging rate. Default is true for safety.

member.name: T:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the version, edition and other aspects of running operating system.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_CLEANBOOT
member.summary: The value that specifies how the system is started: 0 Normal boot 1 Fail-safe boot 2 Fail-safe with network boot A fail-safe boot (also called SafeBoot, Safe Mode, or Clean Boot) bypasses the user startup files.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_CMONITORS
member.summary: The number of display monitors on a desktop.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_CMOUSEBUTTONS
member.summary: The number of buttons on a mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, 0 if not.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_SERVERR2
member.summary: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_STARTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 Starter Edition, Windows Vista Starter, or Windows XP Starter Edition; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition or if the current operating system is Windows Vista or Windows 7 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_DIGITIZER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The return value is a bitmask that specifies the type of digitizer input supported by the device. (Only supported in Windows 7 an newer.)

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES
member.summary: Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0. SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES returns the aggregate maximum of the maximum number of contacts supported by every digitizer in the system. If the system has only single-touch digitizers, the return value is 1. If the system has multi-touch digitizers, the return value is the number of simultaneous contacts the hardware can provide. (Only supported in Windows 7 an newer.)

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_BACKOFFICE
member.summary: Microsoft BackOffice components are installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_BLADE
member.summary: Windows Server 2003, Web Edition is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_COMPUTE_SERVER
member.summary: Windows Server 2003, Compute Cluster Edition is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_DATACENTER
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 Datacenter, Windows Server 2003, Datacenter Edition, or Windows 2000 Datacenter Server is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_ENTERPRISE
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 Enterprise, Windows Server 2003, Enterprise Edition, or Windows 2000 Advanced Server is installed. Refer to the Remarks section for more information about this bit flag.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_EMBEDDEDNT
member.summary: Windows XP Embedded is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_PERSONAL
member.summary: Windows Vista Home Premium, Windows Vista Home Basic, or Windows XP Home Edition is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_SINGLEUSERTS
member.summary: Remote Desktop is supported, but only one interactive session is supported. This value is set unless the system is running in application server mode.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_SMALLBUSINESS
member.summary: Microsoft Small Business Server was once installed on the system, but may have been upgraded to another version of Windows.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_SMALLBUSINESS_RESTRICTED
member.summary: Microsoft Small Business Server is installed with the restrictive client license in force.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_STORAGE_SERVER
member.summary: Windows Storage Server 2003 R2 or Windows Storage Server 2003 is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_TERMINAL
member.summary: Terminal Services is installed. This value is always set. If VER_SUITE_TERMINAL is set but VER_SUITE_SINGLEUSERTS is not set, the system is running in application server mode.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.VER_SUITE_WH_SERVER
member.summary: Windows Home Server is installed.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_INTEGRATED_TOUCH
member.summary: An integrated (built-in) touch digitizer is used for input.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_EXTERNAL_TOUCH
member.summary: An external (connected) touch digitizer is used for input.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_INTEGRATED_PEN
member.summary: An integrated (built-in) pen digitizer is used for input.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_EXTERNAL_PEN
member.summary: An external (connected) pen digitizer is used for input.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_MULTI_INPUT
member.summary: An input digitizer with support for multiple inputs is used for input.

member.name: F:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.NID_READY
member.summary: The input digitizer is ready for input. If this value is unset, it may mean that the tablet service is stopped, the digitizer is not supported, or digitizer drivers have not been installed.

member.summary: Gets the installed service pack name.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.Is64Bit
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a 64 bit system is running.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.Build
member.summary: Gets the Windows version build number.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.ServicePackBuild
member.summary: Gets the service pack build number.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.ProductName
member.summary: Gets the complete operating system product name from the registry, including Windows version and edition name. This can be used if correctness is required and the value does not need to be evaluated.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsAppServer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the system is set up as application terminal server.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.Language
member.summary: Gets the ISO 639-1/ISO 3166 language/country code of the system language.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.LastBootTime
member.summary: Gets the time when the system was last booted, in UTC.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsFailSafeBoot
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the system is started in fail-safe mode.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.AppCompatLayer
member.summary: Gets the application compatibility layers that are in effect for the current process.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.ClrType
member.summary: Gets the CLR type running the current process. This is either "Microsoft .NET" or "Mono".

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.MouseButtons
member.summary: Gets the number of buttons on a mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.MaxTouchPoints
member.summary: Gets the number of supported touch points.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.ScreenDpi
member.summary: Gets the logical resolution of the screen. 100 % is 96 dpi.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsWindowsXPOrNewer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the OS version is Windows XP/Server 2003 or newer.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsWindowsVistaOrNewer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the OS version is Windows Vista/Server 2008 or newer.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsWindows7OrNewer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the OS version is Windows 7/Server 2008 R2 or newer.

member.name: P:Unclassified.FieldLog.OSInfo.IsWindows8OrNewer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the OS version is Windows 8/Server 2012 or newer.
